Happens regularly in the block. Please remove.

item.title: Yellow box markings, 4th October
item.description:
Can the yellow box at the junction of Well St and Cassland Rd be repainted, please? It is very worn and motorists are not obeying "give way" rules, which causes congestion and frustration for drivers. A camera would be very useful at this junction too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cassland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suitcase dumped in ourside, 4th October
item.description:
Suitcase been dumped approximately a week outside 7a/7b - I have liaised with upstairs and it does not belong to either household. Concerned as we are not sure what could be inside the suitcase.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Thorncombe Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Opposite side of road to 58 Eton Avenue, 4th October
item.description:
Tree has blown over significantly in the wind, though not completely down yet. Partially blocking the pavement. Website says this was fixed on 25th Sept, but definitely needs looking at again asap. May need propping up or work done to stabilise it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Eton Avenue, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Traffic light sequence, 4th October
item.description:
The new lights at the junction of Well St and Frampton Park road cause a great deal of traffic congestion, often backing up into Mare St. Very little traffic crosses from Frampton Park into Ainsworth Rd. Can the sequencing be changed to reflect this please? This would ease congestion (and pollution) in Well St.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown unmaintained trees, 4th October
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern about the overgrown willow trees along our street. Every time we experience windy weather, large amounts of branches, sticks, and leaves are being blown off these trees and scattered across the road, driveways, gardens, and even onto vehicles blocking guttering. As you can see from the recent situation, the debris is causing repeated mess and potential damage to property. Itâ€™s becoming increasingly frustrating and hazardous, especially when branches hit cars or block the pavements. These willow trees clearly need to be trimmed and properly maintained to prevent further issues. I kindly ask that the council arrange for an inspection and pruning as soon as possible. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crouch Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped BMW, 4th October
item.description:
